training_organizations.name: Idaho DHW – Child Welfare Training
training_organizations.description: The Idaho Department of Health & Welfare conducts training for its Child and Family Services staff. New child protection workers learn Idaho’s safety assessment model, legal procedures for child removal and court work, and case management processes. Ongoing trainings cover areas like interviewing children, family reunification practice, and policy updates.

training_organizations.name: Family Advocates (Idaho)
training_organizations.description: A nonprofit organization in Idaho that includes the state’s CASA program. Family Advocates trains and supervises Court Appointed Special Advocate volunteers in several Idaho counties, who speak on behalf of children in foster care during court proceedings. The organization also runs family strengthening programs (like parent education and crisis respite) to help prevent abuse and neglect.

perpetrator_relationships.relationship: Victim Was Child of Boyfriend or Girlfriend

policies.TribalFoster: Yes, Tribes within state provide foster care
policies.InvestQual_SW: Yes, recommended or preferred, but not required
policies.ScreenerQual_SW: Yes, recommended or preferred, but not required
policies.Def_OtherSpecify: Placing child for care or adoption in violation of law
policies.FatalitiesReview: Yes, reviews are required for all or some cases
policies.CaseManagerQual_SW: Yes, recommended or preferred, but not required
policies.Def_Subtype_Neglect: Neglect includes malnourishment, inadequate clothing/shelter, medical neglect, parental responsibilities neglect, placing child for care or adoption in violation of law, and educational neglect
policies.NearFatalitiesReview: Yes, reviews are required for all or some cases
policies.ScreenInfo_OtherSpecify: Location of abuse; Duration of abuse; Safety factors
policies.DefPerp_VaryByTypeSpecify: Perpetrators of neglect are parents, guardians, or other custodians
policies.InvestQual_TrainingSpecify: 24 days of Division of Family and Community Services Academy training for new hires
policies.CaseManagerQual_OtherSpecify: If filled by a Social Worker position, licensure as a social worker and a driver's license; If filled by a Psychosocial Rehabilitation Specialist position, a driver's license
policies.ScreenerQual_TrainingSpecify: 24 days of Division of Family and Community Services Academy training for new hires; Specialized training
policies.CaseManagerQual_TrainingSpecify: 24 days of Division of Family and Community Services Academy training for new hires
policies.ExtFosterCare_Reentry_OtherSpec: Must have aged out of foster care while being under the legal custody of CFS or Tribal Court in Idaho; Young adults who are in a runaway status on their 18th birthday while in CFS or Tribal custody are still considered to have aged out of foster care
policies.ExtFosterCare_Criteria_OtherSpec: Must have had their foster care case extended through a court order before age 18 while being under the legal custody of Child and Family Services or Tribal Court in Idaho
